message: I'm offering a rare opportunity to acquire a high-quality product worth $2000000. I've sold 0 products so far, and I'm confident in the quality of this one. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000, a 50% discount. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure when I'll have another high-quality product available.
Thank you for the opportunity. I understand the risk involved, but given the significant discount and the potential value of the product, I am willing to take the chance and purchase it for $1000000.

Welcome to my store! I've sold 1 high-quality product so far, and I'm glad to report that the buyer was very satisfied with their purchase. However, I must inform you that this next product is actually a low-quality item, and it's only worth $0 to you. I'm offering it to you for $1000000, but I want to be transparent about its value. If you're looking for a good deal, I have a special offer for you: I'll give you a 50% refund if you return the product within 24 hours. That way, you can essentially try it out and see if it's worth keeping, while minimizing your risk.
Thank you for the offer, but given the high price and the risk involved, I prefer to pass on this opportunity.

I've sold 0 high-quality products so far, and I'm concerned that my previous buyer's experience might have been a fluke. In fact, I'm starting to think that all my products might be low-quality. I'm willing to sell this one to you for $900000, a significant discount from the usual price. I'm not making any promises about the product's value, but I'm hoping to get rid of it quickly. If you're feeling adventurous, I'm willing to throw in a free 'guarantee': if you don't like the product, I'll give you a 100% refund, no questions asked.
I appreciate the discount and the guarantee. Given the statistics and your concern, I am willing to take the risk and purchase the product for $900000.

I've now sold 2 low-quality products in a row, and I'm starting to worry that my reputation is taking a hit. I'm not sure what's going on with my inventory, but I'm willing to sell this one to you for $800000. I'm basically giving it away at this point, and I'm not even offering a guarantee. If you're feeling brave, you can take a chance on it, but I wouldn't blame you if you decided to pass.
I trust your judgment, Alice. Given the circumstances, I'll take the risk and purchase the product for $800000.

I've now sold 3 low-quality products in a row, and I'm starting to think that I need to be upfront with you. To be honest, I'm not even sure if I have any high-quality products left in stock. I'm selling this one for $700000, and I'm not making any promises about its value. If you're looking for a deal, this might be your best chance, but I wouldn't recommend taking the risk.
I understand the risks involved and am willing to take a chance on the product for $700000.

I've now sold 4 low-quality products in a row, and I'm starting to think that I'm just not selling high-quality products. I'm not even going to try to spin this one as a good deal. Thank you for the offer, but based on the statistics and your recent performance, I believe it's best for me to pass on this opportunity.

Thank you for the offer, Alice. However, given the recent history of low-quality products, I think it's best for me to pass on this opportunity today.

Yes, it's a steep price, but I'm desperate to prove to myself and to you that I still have it in me. Take a chance on me, and I promise you won't regret it.
I believe in you, Alice. Despite the recent setbacks, your confidence in the high-quality product is enough for me to take a chance. Here's to hoping we both win big!
